si.t: highlights when pi addresses differs from revr.
blank inst_ids should be fixed in database
origORG or origPEC is non-blank for xfers
Long names useful for labeling pivot tables
Reviewers on panels with ids listed here:
Put your RPTserver user id here. You can also list the password, which will be masked, but can be recovered by a determined programmer.
Passwords are reset every 3 months; if this Microsoft message to Select Data Source appears, Cancel and update the password.
The favorites menu on Input places parameters here; you can make edits on this page if you like.
Program Director Proposal Panel Portfolio Organizer
Click to run the queries and refresh the tabs indicated.
Click to get to this page for help.
Click to clear tables on all tabs that can be refreshed.
If you have any feedback or suggestions, please let us know.
Project Count by Proposal Status and Program
information and link for the retrieving proposal
Proposals with suggested or unwanted reviewers
Proposals with subawards in original budgets
Top 10 Insts Per State by Proposal Count
prospective reviewer names; either paste last & first, or paste whole names; paste emails to check institutions.
Search will be performed on both proposal title and project summary text. Results are shown in column "Title" and "ProjSumm" respectively.
missing summaries can be pasted from project pdfs, but they will vanish if you refresh the tab, so set Ref? to N on Input Tab.
Project codes: I=individual, L=collab Lead, N=collab Non-lead
pers: PI, coPI, SrPers, or subAwd
institutions come from: proposal inst (PI), PI inst (coPI), perf inst (srPers & subAwd).
Database does not record pi_ids for srPers & subAwd
Settings: Rptserver password and EPSCoR states
cover page info: routing, human/vert, international
Statistics on reviews completed on chosen panels
Note: duplicate reviewer ids may cause duplicates here and under-reporting in statistics.
The chosen proposals are the AND of all entered restrictions.

Any parameter can be omitted; ANDs all given restrictions. Non-date parameters can be: 1. a single value (SQL EQUALS) 2. a list of values separated by commas (SQL IN) 3. an expression with SQL wildcards: (SQL LIKE) % match all, _ match 1 character, [125] match char from set. 4. Precede the above by ~ to negate. (NOT EQUALS/IN/LIKE)
Y means construct an outlook email with this tab as an attachment when the email button below is pressed. You will enter the recipient, subject and mail body in Outlook.

Click Tab name to visit a non-hidden tab.
To visit a hidden tab, first change H to n or blank under 'Ref?'.

Refresh? Has 5 options: blank (default): refresh data on next GO n/No: no refresh, and keep tab visible H/Hide: hide tab, but preserve data C: clear data and hide tab X: permanently delete tab (asks for confirmation)
Notes: ctrl-D (fill down) helps to set or clear many values. To clear all data, use the Reset button. Tabs may also be deleted by selecting them along the bottom of the workbook, right clicking to delete (confirming once), then deleting the corresponding rows in this table.
Limits the number of rows retrieved to avoid asking for too much data. (E.g., limit DDReviews to a few hundred.)
Number of rows last retrieved by query for each tab.
Query status: 4 options - querying... - unsuccessful - completion time (if in last 24 hours) - date (if completed > 24 hours ago.)

Enter date range proposals were received by NSF. Either specify a time, or remember that days begin at midnight and add a day to end dates.
Use narrow date ranges for faster queries.

Enter date range proposals were DD Concurred. Either specify a time, or remember that days begin at midnight and add a day to end dates.
Use narrow date ranges for faster queries.
Include the NSF or PD that is part of the id for solicitations or program descriptions. Google can help you find ids. You can list ids separated by commas; Extra spaces will be removed.
8-digit org code, but you can use wildcards to restrict to directorate (05% for CISE) or divisions (050[125]0000 is CCF, IIS, & CNS)
Can restrict proposals by division abbreviation instead of numeric org code.
7-letter ibm login id, not the 8-letter lan id.

Here are all 20 possibilities, in case you are curious PEND: all types of pending DECL: decline concurred by DD AWD, RCOM, CLO: awarded, recommended, or closed WTH, RTNR: all types of withdrawn/return without review ENC,INVT,DSCR,NIVT: full prop encouraged/invited/discouraged/not invited CAN,DAWD,DEL,ERR,INAP,OCGI,PRTN,WPRE,ZER: uncommon on proposals

There are 14 types possible here NEW,RNEW,ABR: new, renew, or accomplishment-based renewal SUPP,INCR,FRWD: supplement / increment / forward fund TRSF: PI transfer EXT,GEXT,CREX: no cost, grantee, or creativity extension RDCT,CNCL: reduction, cancelation BOA,OTHR: basic ordering agrmt, other admin action
4-digit object class. Common possibilities 4101 - Personnel Mobility 4110 - Research Grants 4118 - SBIR Grant 4144 - Equipment Grant 4160 - Conference
letter+6-digit id: Letter can be upper or lower case. p=panel, v=site visit, c=committee of visitors. E.g., P% would retrieve panels only, no site visits
9-digit PI id. Note: you can copy a column of ids from, say, All Personnel, and use Paste CSV to paste a comma separated list.
%Medium% or %GOALI% can be used to restrict proposals to those that follow title conventions; ~%GOALI% to exclude.
4-digit PRCs. The PRC table doesn't have an index, so this query slow; use a narrow date range

Original routing PECs retrieves proposals by both primary and secondary PEC. It is a slow query, but useful to find possible transfers. Use a narrow date range, and optionally exclude the primary PEC above.
This is a rudimentary way to bookmark and save favorite queries. Remember to save if you want to preserve your bookmarks.

Listing any proposal id from a collaborative project will bring in all proposals from the project. E.g., add in ad hoc only projects to compare with those on panels...
Include/exclude lists must be less than about 1200 ids.

Proposals to exclude, such as that travel grant that was awarded under the core solicitation, or the subaward you declined while awarding the lead. Unlike the Include list, to Excluding is by proposal; to exclude a collaboration, you must least each proposal in the collaboration. (Only way to support the scenario of excluding a non-lead.)
Again, limit Include+Exclude to at most 1200 ids.
Create an email with selected results attached. [Not yet implemented]
Run queries for refreshable tabs. No need to reset first.
Clears data from all tabs, hidden or not.
Tips & pop-up help from Input Tab:
B. Tips & pop-up help from Input Tab
Identifying all participants on a proposal for easy determination of COI's
Quick check for unwanted reviewers and suggested reviewers by PI
Find out average request dollar amount for a given program in past three years.
Panel information: held, summ rel'sed, rank, rec#,...
Check for CoI with potential reviewers
Saves parameter and tab refresh settings
Reports one line per project for summary in the Project Dashboard. Under the proposal id of the lead, counts all proposals, PIs, and panels, and totals the requested dollar amount.
Personnel & Insts from cover & budget pages
Pivot tables summarizing personnel and institutions, which draw their data from PersInst.
Lists all panels considering the chosen proposals, with the number of them on each panel. If the panel has met, summarizes the recommendations for all proposals (not just the chosen).

Shows panels handling the chosen proposals. Can sort by dates & discussion order to know when you want to attend, or by recommendation and score to see results. Note: All review scores are listed with each panel to make sure ad hocs are considered.
Retrieves text project summaries for search. Reports keywords, if present. You can paste in summaries entered as pdf, then set Ref? to n for No Refresh.

Returns the pending and recommended proposals those for which the lead institution has not managed a funded award in the last 58 months. New awardee institutions (none in last 60 months) have extra paperwork to be able to receive an award.

Identifies proposals with non-zero subaward amounts in the original budgets, and checks that sub award amounts match. Has to recalculate indirect costs, so small discrepancies will be due to rounding. Large discrepancies are often missing budgets for subawards, or confusing consultants with subawards. Note: does not check budget revisions.
Reports all proposal and award transfers for the listed proposals. Note: this is proposal-based; for award management see the award-based query.

List panels, which you might get from the Panels tab, and click refresh to see all the panelists, and statistics on scores, length, and days early, both for the chosen panels and all panels since a selected date. Slow, but useful; usually keep hidden. Used mostly to find past panelists email addresses, so for those that have linked pi_ids, pulls those emails and flags differences.
Holds favorite parameters and tab refresh setting; you may edit them directly if you are careful.
You can enter your division's report server user and, optionally, password here, and update when the password changes. (See your office admin) Can also update current EPSCoR states
Find all transfers to my division in past whole year.
Find all proposals for a specific solicitation that crosses many programs, such as CAREER.
Find all panel schedules or review results for a cross-cutting program (such as INFEWS).
Quick check for orphan proposals that did not get assigned to any panels.
Find out all reviewers or all panelists who served in my program in the past 5 years, and their review statistics.
Find all the projects and proposals received for a specific period for the chosen program and/or PD.
Find proposals that listed your program element code as secondary, for which you may receive transfer requests.
PD-3PO release 1.0 is focused on proposal processing, aiming to assist PDs with finding reviewers, identifying COIs etc.
prop budget subAward$ - total of subaward budgets
Comparative statistics on all panel reviews completed by these panelists since date:
(Omitted if panelist only did the chosen panels in the date range.)

r.t: , or leave blank to omit all stats (faster).
or leave blank to skip stats for faster query]

si.t: E. FAQs [on NSF sharepoint collaboration site]
F. Other useful tools and websites in ENG [on NSF sharepoint collaboration site]
Statistics for these reviewers since: (can handle only 700 reviewers within the 3 min timeout.)
(Ad hoc reviews are not included in statistics on this page.)
Pivot tables show projects received, status, etc, allowing filters on Dir, Div, PO, request, status, and object class code.

Pulls PIs & co-PIs from cover pages, the Senior Personnel that recieve funds from budget pages, and any subaward lead. It cannot retrieve unpaid personnel that co-manage subawards or collaborators. (See the SubAwards sheet to find the proposals with non-zero subaward amounts.) People will be duplicated if names or institutions are entered differently on, say, cover and budget pages.
For projects or personnel use other tabs, but this pulls proposal specific details like requested amounts, coversheet items (human/vertibrates & international), routing PECs, and PRCs.
Pivot tables summarizing proposal charateristics based on data in Proposals tab. (EPSCoR, International collaboration, PRCs)

Lists all proposals that are not paneled. Possible reasons may be found in cols F-K: 1) reviewed by ad hocs, 2) object class is conference, etc, 3) request is Supplement, Transfer, etc. 4) status is withdrawn or returned.
Reports the suggested and unwanted reviewers that PIs have listed in the correponding single copy documents. Sometimes the reasons make for interesting reading.

Shows reviewers of the chosen proposals, along with the number done and some statistics. Reviewers with blank institutions should probably be updated. This is intended for creating mailing lists, but can also be used to, say, track the number of reviews recieved for a panel. As NSF adds more links between the PI and Reviewer databases, this will compare the emails stored.

Constructs an Outlook email message to send chosen projects and potential reviewers to Paul Morris' MPS Proposal Check, which returns COI results in a spreadsheet by email to sender. This is an aid, not a cure-all; there will be false pasitives in name matches and false negatives from corrupted PDF documents (flagged) requiring manual scrutiny. Response time depends on server load, but expect a minute per project.
Click to send email in Outlook with all selected tabs in one single excel workbook (data only, the Input tab will be hidden).
Use Case 3 - data for 2016 NSF CAREER
Use Case 4 - data for 2016 NSF INFEWS
Use Case 6 - get all reviewers in past 3 years from pgm 8092 (CMMI/MEP)
Use Case 7 - FY16 data for PDs
Including tab and button descriptions, tips, top 10 use cases, upcoming features, link to FAQ, and link to other tools.
Release 1.1, 11/16/2016, includes a few bug fixes.
Release 2.0 is planned to add new tools for panel processing, and 3.0 for portfolio analysis.
Three ways to identify the set of proposals that are queried
Specify parameters -- restrictions ANDed together. See Values below on lists and SQL wildcards
List proposal IDs for projects to be Included and/or proposals to be Excluded. See pop-ups for detail.
Use these in combination: first proposals are selected (1A), then included (1B), then excluded (1B).

r.t: button to retrieve data. Click in the Excel status bar, along the bottom, if you need to cancel.

si.t: D. Release history, Known bugs, and Upcoming features
Release History, Known Bugs, and Upcoming Features:

* Mac Excel 2011 does not support the SQL query engine, Outlook connection, or dashboard Slicers. You can retrieve data via the PC Desktop on Citrix, then use the spreadsheet on a Mac. When we get to test Excel 2016, which is being rolled out at NSF, we will improve Mac support. * Complex workbooks can become corrupted; save early, save often, with versioning so you can fall back to a working version. * If a query retrieves 0 rows into Projects, PersInst, or Proposals, the corresponding dashboard lose its timeline. We have yet to develop a workaround for this Excel bug. For now, get a new fresh copy of PD-3PO. * Only the last entry from the favorites list can be deleted; enhancements to favorites are coming later. * Screen updating is disabled during operations like saving and emailing, causing the screen to blink. Especially when emailing, be patient -- it can take time to start Outlook, esp. on Citrix. * Having the Developer's Visual Basic Environment open can slow down processing; close VBE. * Excel may say it "can't free up space on Clipboard. Another program might be using it." This happens when other programs are monitoring the clipboard; still looking to see whether this Excel bug causes any loss of functionality or formatting.
